content:
EXISTING STRUCTURES
─────────────────────
### Copper Cable Factory Interface at (2.5, 17.5)
Consists of the following entities:
– Cable factory input chest at (2.5, 17.5)
– Factory burner inserter placed at (3.5, 17.5) using direction RIGHT  
  • Neighbours include an auxiliary burner inserter (retrieved at (2.5, 16.5)) and an assembling‑machine‑1 at (1.5, 19.5)

### Belt Depot Structure at (3.5, 15.5)
Consists of the following entities:
– Wooden chest serving as belt depot at (3.5, 15.5)
– Dedicated transport belt segment placed adjacent at (4.5, 15.5)
– Depot burner inserter placed at (3.5, 14.5) using direction UP, which interfaces with the chest and belt segment

ERROR TIPS
──────────
• Errors connecting transport belts to an invalid target  
  – When attempting to connect a belt, the error “Transport belts cannot be connected directly to a Prototype.SteamEngine object as a target. You need to add an inserter that inputs items into Prototype.SteamEngine and use the inserter as the target entity.” appears repeatedly.  
  – Tip: Always ensure that the belt’s target is an appropriate inserter rather than a steam engine.

• Errors during wooden chest placement  
  – “Could not place wooden-chest at (3.5, 15.5): The target position is too far away…” indicates that the player must move nearer to the placement position before attempting to place an entity.  
  – “NameError: name 'target_chest' is not defined” shows that the variable used in the placement routine is misnamed or not defined.  
  – “Could not place wooden chest at (3.5,15.5) after moving: No wooden_chest in inventory” indicates a missing item in inventory; verify inventory contents before placement.
